Generation I.Red: If interrupted while it is miming, it will slap around the offender with its broad hands.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: If interrupted while it is miming, it will slap around the offender with its broad hands.
Generation I.Yellow: Always practices its pantomime act. It makes enemies believe something exists that really doesn't.
Generation I.Stadium: It is an expert at miming and loves to perform. It is said to slap around anyone who disturbs it with its broad hands.

Generation II.Gold: A skilled mime from birth, it gains the ability to create invisible objects as it matures.
Generation II.Silver: Its fingertips emit a peculiar force field that hardens air to create an actual wall.
Generation II.Crystal: It uses the mysterious power it has in its fingers to solidify air into an invisible wall.
Generation II.Stadium 2: A skilled mime from birth, it gains the ability to create invisible objects as it matures. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Its fingertips emit a peculiar force field that hardens air to create an actual wall. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Mr. Mime is a master of pantomime. Its gestures and motions convince watchers that something unseeable actually exists. Once it is believed, it will exist as if it were a real thing.
Generation III.Sapphire: Mr. Mime is a master of pantomime. Its gestures and motions convince watchers that something unseeable actually exists. Once it is believed, it will exist as if it were a real thing.
Generation III.Emerald: A Mr. Mime is a master of pantomime. It can convince others that something unseeable actually exists. Once believed, the imaginary object does become real.
Generation III.FireRed: It is adept at conning people. It is said to be able to create walls out of thin air by miming.
Generation III.LeafGreen: If interrupted while it is miming, it will suddenly DoubleSlap the offender with its broad hands.

Generation IV.Diamond: It is a pantomime expert that can create invisible but solid walls using miming gestures.
Generation IV.Pearl: Emanations from its fingertips solidify the air into invisible walls that repel even harsh attacks.
Generation IV.Platinum: It shapes an invisible wall in midair by minutely vibrating its fingertips to stop molecules in the air.
Generation IV.HeartGold: A skilled mime from birth, it gains the ability to create invisible objects as it matures.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Its fingertips emit a peculiar force field that hardens air to create an actual wall.

Generation V.Black: It shapes an invisible wall in midair by minutely vibrating its fingertips to stop molecules in the air.
Generation V.White: It shapes an invisible wall in midair by minutely vibrating its fingertips to stop molecules in the air.
Generation V.Black 2: It shapes an invisible wall in midair by minutely vibrating its fingertips to stop molecules in the air.
Generation V.White 2: It shapes an invisible wall in midair by minutely vibrating its fingertips to stop molecules in the air.

Generation VI.X: Emanations from its fingertips solidify the air into invisible walls that repel even harsh attacks.
Generation VI.Y: It is adept at conning people. It is said to be able to create walls out of thin air by miming.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Mr. Mime is a master of pantomime. Its gestures and motions convince watchers that something unseeable actually exists. Once the watchers are convinced, the unseeable thing exists as if it were real.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Mr. Mime is a master of pantomime. Its gestures and motions convince watchers that something unseeable actually exists. Once the watchers are convinced, the unseeable thing exists as if it were real.

Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Its pantomime skills are wonderful. You may become enraptured while watching it, but next thing you know, Mr. Mime has made a real wall.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It creates invisible walls with its pantomiming. If you don't act impressed, it will attack you with a double slap!
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Always practicing its pantomime act. It makes enemies believe something exists that really doesn't.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Always practicing its pantomime act. It makes enemies believe something exists that really doesn't.

Generation VIII.Sword: Its talent is tap-dancing. It can also manipulate temperatures to create a floor of ice, which this Pokémon can kick up to use as a barrier.
Generation VIII.Shield: It can radiate chilliness from the bottoms of its feet. It'll spend the whole day tap-dancing on a frozen floor.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It is a pantomime expert that can create invisible but solid walls using miming gestures.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Emanations from its fingertips solidify the air into invisible walls that repel even harsh attacks.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: The behavior of this clown-like Pokémon reminds one of pantomime. It creates invisible walls using a force emitted from its fingertips.

Generation IV.SoulSilver: Route 21 , Celadon Game Corner Safari Zone (Forest, default Morning Day , and with 3 Plains points)
